intro: Teucrium schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian germander, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Teucrium schimperi is often found in rocky or well-drained soils in mountainous regions.
